Title: Letter from John S. Billiu, 1861 May 14
Subject - Name [corporate]: Confederate States of America. Army. Louisiana Infantry Regiment, 4th
Biographical Information: John S. Billiu was a soldier serving in the 4th Louisiana Infantry Regiment who later became captain of the Lafourche Guards.  He was a lawyer and later represented Lafourche Parish in the Louisiana House of Representatives (1880-1884).

Title: Letter from John S. Billiu to his wife, 1861 June 13
Subject - Name [corporate]: Confederate States of America. Army. Louisiana Infantry Regiment, 4th
Abstract (Description): John S. Billiu describes camp life and the East Pascagoula Hotel. A notice from the proprietor of the hotel is enclosed.
Biographical Information: John S. Billiu was a soldier serving in the 4th Louisiana Infantry Regiment who later became captain of the Lafourche Guards.  He was a lawyer and later represented Lafourche Parish in the Louisiana House of Representatives (1880-1884).
Note [content] (Note): A notice from the proprietor of the East Pascagoula Hotel is attached to John S. Billiu's letter.

Title: Letter from John S. Billiu to his wife, 1861 November 4
Subject - Name [corporate]: Confederate States of America. Army. Louisiana Infantry Regiment, 4th
Abstract (Description): John S. Billiu writes to his wife from an encampment near Bayou Teche, where his company waits to drive the Yankees back should they attempt an attack on New Orleans. He mentions his plans to resign for the winter and return for a spring campaign.
Biographical Information: John S. Billiu was a soldier serving in the 4th Louisiana Infantry Regiment who later became captain of the Lafourche Guards.  He was a lawyer and later represented Lafourche Parish in the Louisiana House of Representatives (1880-1884).

Title: Letter from John S. Billiu to his wife, 1862 January 29
Subject - Name [corporate]: Confederate States of America. Army. Louisiana Infantry Regiment, 4th
Abstract (Description): John S. Billiu describes life at Camp Hunter and updates his wife on the status of his resignation, which he fears will be rejected.
Biographical Information: John S. Billiu was a soldier serving in the 4th Louisiana Infantry Regiment who later became captain of the Lafourche Guards.  He was a lawyer and later represented Lafourche Parish in the Louisiana House of Representatives (1880-1884).

Title: Letter from John S. Billiu to his wife and letter from Edward to his brother Frank, 1862 March 13-18
Subject - Name [corporate]: Confederate States of America. Army. Louisiana Infantry Regiment, 4th
Abstract (Description): This item consists of two letters dated 1862 March 13 and March 18. In the first letter, John S. Billiu announces his promotion to captain of the Lafourche Guards. In the second letter, signed "Edward," the writer addresses his brother, Frank, and gives his opinions on Billiu's promotion.
Biographical Information: John S. Billiu was a soldier serving in the 4th Louisiana Infantry Regiment who later became captain of the Lafourche Guards.  He was a lawyer and later represented Lafourche Parish in the Louisiana House of Representatives (1880-1884).

Title: Account of a Confirmation, 1880 September 26
Abstract (Description): This document is titled "The night I was confirmed."
